title: HTML Meta Tags
subject: HTML
learning_objectives: Set description and keywords for SEO
theory:
# HTML Meta Tags

The `<meta>` tag defines metadata about an HTML document. Metadata is data about data.
*   `<meta>` tags always go inside the `<head>` element.
*   Metadata is not displayed on the page, but is machine parsable.
*   Used by browsers (how to display content), search engines (keywords), and other web services.

## Important Meta Tags

### 1. Character Set
Specifies the character encoding for the HTML document. `UTF-8` covers almost all characters and symbols in the world.
```html
<meta charset="UTF-8">
```

### 2. Viewport (Crucial for Mobile)
Controls the dimensions and scaling of the page. Essential for responsive design.
```html
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
```
*   `width=device-width`: Sets page width to follow screen-width.
*   `initial-scale=1.0`: Sets initial zoom level.

### 3. Description
Defines a description of your web page. Browsers/Search Engines often use this for the snippet in search results.
```html
<meta name="description" content="Free HTML tutorials for beginners">
```

### 4. Keywords
Defines keywords for search engines (Less important now as Google ignores it, but good to know).
```html
<meta name="keywords" content="HTML, CSS, JavaScript">
```

### 5. Author
Defines the author of a page.
```html
<meta name="author" content="John Doe">
```

### 6. Refresh
Refresh document every 30 seconds.
```html
<meta http-equiv="refresh" content="30">
```

examples.code:
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <meta name="description" content="Best HTML Course">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
</head>
examples.explanation: Standard head configuration for a modern responsive site.

common_mistakes.correction: If omitted, mobile browsers will render the page as if it's on a desktop and scale it down, making text tiny and unreadable.

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the viewport meta tag?
interview_questions.answer: It gives the browser instructions on how to control the page's dimensions and scaling. It is essential for responsive web design to ensure the site looks good on mobile devices.

interview_questions.question: Why use charset='UTF-8'?
interview_questions.answer: UTF-8 is a versatile character encoding that supports almost every character from every language, preventing garbled text (mojibake).

practice_problems.problem: Write the metadata to set the author to 'Jane' and description to 'My Portfolio'.

real_world_use_cases.description: The 'description' meta tag is often the text shown under your blue link in Google Search results. Valid metadata improves click-through rates.

summary: Meta tags communicate important information to the browser and search engines. While invisible to the user, they control critical aspects like character encoding, mobile responsiveness, and SEO descriptions.
